headline.main: Why French Parents Are Superior (in One Way)

docs.abstract: American children are three times more likely to be overweight than French kids, because we don't teach our children how to eat.
docs.snippet: American children are three times more likely to be overweight than French kids, because we don't teach our children how to eat.

headline.main: When the Chef Is Also a Doctor

docs.abstract: To Dr. David M. Eisenberg, an associate professor at the Harvard Medical School and the Harvard School of Public Health, flavor is a health issue. That's why he has started teaching doctors how to cook.
docs.snippet: To Dr. David M. Eisenberg, an associate professor at the Harvard Medical School and the Harvard School of Public Health, flavor is a health issue. That's why he has started teaching doctors how to cook.

headline.seo: Doctors Learn to Cook Healthy, ‘Crave-able’ Foods

docs.abstract: Pediatricians, endocrinologists, dietitians and other health practitioners spend three and a half days at a conference in Napa Vally learning how to cook; now in its eighth year, 'Healthy Kitchens/Healthy Lives' is in the vanguard of a major shift in attitude among a young generation of medical professionals who understand the value of good nutrition and healthy eating.
docs.lead_paragraph: An annual conference teaches doctors to wear chefs’ toques.
docs.snippet: An annual conference teaches doctors to wear chefs’ toques.

headline.main: Economic Theory Plots a Course for Good Food

docs.abstract: Tyler Cowen, an economist, offers guidelines on getting a good inexpensive meal at various restaurants, in his new book An Economist Gets Lunch.
docs.lead_paragraph: Lunch with the economist Tyler Cowen, whose new book offers guidance on getting a good meal.

headline.print_headline: Preparing for Real Life With Pixels
headline.main: Preparing for Real Life With Pixels

docs.lead_paragraph: The gloomy outlook for young people in Britain may be different from in the past, partly because of fundamental changes in the way they equip themselves to face the risk of economic renewal.
docs.snippet: The gloomy outlook for young people in Britain may be different from in the past, partly because of fundamental changes in the way they equip themselves to face the risk of economic renewal.

headline.main: Impatience To Get Thin Sends Some To Canada

docs.abstract: Growing number of Americans are traveling to Canada in order to undergo intragastric balloon surgery for weight loss; balloons filled with liquid are left in the stomach for up to six months, allowing patients to feel satiety on less food; procedure is currently undergoing clinical trials to win approval by the Food and Drug Administration, which has in the past been concerned about the severe and frequent complications associated with the device. (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: Tammy Kwarciak, a 44-year-old nurse whose weight had been creeping up for years, was determined to lose 50 pounds. So in February, she drove from her home in Port Huron, Mich., across the border into Canada and had a small balloonlike device inserted into her stomach. The intragastric balloon, filled with liquid and left in the stomach for up to six months, is not approved for use in the United States, though it's available in Europe, South America and other parts of the world. Clinical trials required to win federal Food and Drug Administration approval are being initiated, but many Americans aren't waiting.
docs.snippet: Tammy Kwarciak, a 44-year-old nurse whose weight had been creeping up for years, was determined to lose 50 pounds. So in February, she drove from her home in Port Huron, Mich., across the border into Canada and had a small balloonlike device inserted...

headline.main: 18 And Under: Can Fido and Whiskers Enrich Children's Lives?

docs.abstract: Scientists are bringing rigor to the study of the emotional and psychological effects of pet ownership on children; early evidence suggests that some individual children do experience emotional benefits from relationships with animals, but the details remain elusive. Drawing (M)
docs.lead_paragraph: In this era of mommy confessionals, I must admit: I am not a pet person. With their allergic father, I have reared three children without benefit of in-house canines, felines or invited rodents. But with researchers beginning to focus on children and pets, I find myself interested, though occasionally cynical or defensive.
docs.snippet: In this era of mommy confessionals, I must admit: I am not a pet person. With their allergic father, I have reared three children without benefit of in-house canines, felines or invited rodents.     But with researchers beginning to focus on children...
